description: Change of use from Bank (Use Class A2) to Restaurants and cafes (Use Class A3) and/or Drinking establishments (Use Class A4), including external alterations to the existing shopfront.
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s) - DWG0231 Rev P-02 14 High Street SU02 - Existing Site Plan, DWG0330 Rev P-03 14 High Street SU02- Site Location Plan, DWG0331 Rev P-02 14 High Street SU02 - Proposed Site Plan, DWG0332 Rev P-02 14 High Street SU02 - Existing & Proposed Ground Floor, DWG0333 Rev P-02 14 High Street SU02 - Existing & Proposed Elevations, Design and Access Statement 18665-8001-02 dated March 2020, Covering Letter dated 15 May 2020.
REASON: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match those indicated in the approved plans.

REASON: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2016) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019). | The hours of operation shall be restricted to 07:00 until 24:00hrs Sundays to Thursdays and Public Holidays, and 07:00 until 01:00hrs Fridays and Saturdays. Deliveries of goods to, and waste collections from the proposed development shall only take place during the period 0800 - 1800 hrs on Mondays to Saturdays and at no time on Sundays and Public Holidays.

REASON: In the interests of safeguarding the residential amenity of nearby residents in accordance with Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan (2013), Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 Noise and Vibration, and London Plan (2016) Policy 7.15 and National Planning Policy Framework (2019) - Section 12 Achieving well-designed places. | Prior to commencement of the development, a noise assessment report shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, detailing all types of noise sources within the use, including reflected and re-radiated noise, their noise levels affecting neighbouring residents and noise mitigation measures, to achieve compliance with the acoustic assessment standards of the Council's SPG10 and criteria specified in BS8233:2014. Approved details shall be  implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

REASON: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ adjacent dwellings/ noise sensitive premises is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with Interim Supplementary Planning Guidance 10, policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019). | Prior to commencement of the development, details shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of the external rating noise level emitted from plant/machinery/equipment/ducting/air in- and outlets/mechanical installations, together with mitigation measures as appropriate. The measures shall ensure that the external rating noise level LAeq emitted will be lower than the lowest existing background sound level LA90 by 10dBA at the most noise sensitive receiver locations at the development site and in surrounding premises. The assessment shall be made in accordance with BS4142:2014, with all machinery operating together at maximum capacity. Details of any noise mitigation measures shall be submitted for approval. A post installation sound assessment shall be carried out where required to confirm compliance with the noise criteria and additional steps to mitigate noise shall be taken, as necessary.  Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation/ use of plant/ machinery/ equipment and thereafter be permanently retained.

REASON: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise from mechanical installations/ equipment, in accordance with Policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies and 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), the National Planning Policy Framework (2019) and Interim guidance SPG 10 'Noise and Vibration'. | Prior to use, machinery, plant or equipment/ extraction/ ventilation system and ducting at the development shall be mounted with proprietary anti-vibration isolators and fan motors shall be vibration isolated from the casing and adequately silenced and maintained as such.

REASON: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by vibration/noise from mechanical installations/ equipment, in accordance with Policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies and 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), the National Planning Policy Framework (2019) and Interim guidance SPG 10 'Noise and Vibration'. | The outdoor seating area shall not extend beyond 2.8m in depth from the front facade of the premises.
REASON: To safeguard highway users and pedestrian flow within this public right of way, in accordance with policy 6.3 of the London Plan (2016).
